availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas S. Johnson (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and coroner's jury member)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and coroner's jury member. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza "Ann" Quisenberry Johnson in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on February 14, 1842. Father of Thomas B. Johnson, James W. Johnson, F. Hise Johnson, Lucy E. Johnson, Bivian B. Johnson, Charles F. Johnson, and S. J. S. Johnson. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Member of the coroner's jury in the case of Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 222A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 495B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 248.
